commitResults.messageTitle: [#1616] Fix issue generating repos with special chars on Windows (#1628)
commitResults.messageBody:
Running RepoSense on Windows on repositories containing filenames with
special characters will be skipped entirely. Instead, it should continue
analyzing the repository and skip the problem files.

Let's prevent RepoSense on Windows skipping repositories with filenames
containing special characters.

commitResults.messageTitle: Remove unused variables in Java files (#1673)
commitResults.messageBody:
There are some unused fields and variables in the Java source code,
which adds some unnecessary complexity and makes the code harder to
read.

Let's clean up these unused fields and local variables.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1619] Remove unused GitLsTree class and methods (#1653)
commitResults.messageBody:
GitLsTree class and methods are no longer used. They should be removed
to reduce the maintenance burden.

Let’s remove the unused code in GitLsTree and its test class.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1657] Escape special chars for bash commands (#1662)
commitResults.messageBody:
Special characters in file names are not properly translated into git
commands on bash for non-Windows OS. Usage of single quotes on bash is
only necessary to escape such special characters.

Let's fix the escaping of special characters for bash commands.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1681] Fix log output for cloneFromBareAndUpdateBranch failures (#1683)
commitResults.messageBody:
Logging done upon failure in GitClone::cloneFromBareAndUpdateBranch 
does not include the stack trace. There is also a missing space in the 
logged error message for commands that fail, which can make the log
output confusing to read and trace.

Let's fix these logging issues.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1636] Fix ArrayOutOfBoundsException for binary files (#1663)
commitResults.messageBody:
There are cases where the author of a commit can directly set their
user.email to be empty. This causes an ArrayOutOfBoundsException for
binary files committed by such an author.

Let’s properly handle empty user emails for binary files.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1682] Fix space in local repo causing cloning exception (#1685)
commitResults.messageBody:
Output directories are not quoted which can lead to errors. The 
GitClone::cloneFromBareAndUpdateBranch method is also not standardized
to match other clone methods which always run from the working
directory. This can be difficult to maintain.

Let’s fix the issue of spaces in repo directory causing clone failure
and standardize the cloneFromBareAndUpdateBranch method.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1667] Refactor AnnotatorAnalyzer class (#1687)
commitResults.messageBody:
The AnnotatorAnalyzer class is difficult to understand. It also performs
many null checks even while the Optional class is used. Exception
handling is also used in one part of the normal program flow.

Let's refactor the methods to improve the readability and quality.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1728] GitVersion: Fix insufficient Git version build failure (#1729)
commitResults.messageBody:
Machines with Git version less than 2.23 would experience build failure
from failing several test cases that use git blame --ignore-revs-file. 

Additionally, the current implementation of GitVersion does not 
correctly assess if the machine’s Git version is sufficient to support 
the use of --ignore-revs-file flag.

This change fixes and generalizes the implementation of GitVersion.
It also skips the test cases that would require Git version 2.23 
or higher for a machine that does not have the required Git version.

Let's fix GitVersion and allow developers without Git version 2.23 or 
earlier to properly build RepoSense.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1572] Accept different types of URLs besides https github (#1644)
commitResults.messageBody:
The repo location verification performed in RepoLocation is too 
restrictive and rejects many otherwise valid git clone targets.
External links in the generated webpage also hardcode parts of the
link to be GitHub specific.

This change would allow RepoSense to work with a greater variety of 
locations both remote and local while still providing an appropriate
guess for the organization and repo-name. 

The way external links are generated in the frontend has also been 
changed to support GitHub, GitLab and BitBucket. Support has also 
been implemented to easily include other domain names if needed.

Unsupported repository links (local or unsupported remote) will no
longer open an external webpage when clicked.

Let's allow RepoSense to work with a greater variety of locations.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1641] Fix tilde pathing in repo config not working (#1727)
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, if a local repo file path starting with a tilde is specified
in repo-config.csv file, the entire file path is quoted and tilde
expansion will not be performed.

This change performs bash expansion via an echo command for repo-config
locations. However, the responsibility still falls onto the user to
properly specify their location should they decide to use variable/tilde
expansion.

Let's allow use of variable/tilde expansion in repo-config.csv.

commitResults.messageTitle: Release Logger resources once RepoSense finishes processing (#1747)
commitResults.messageBody:
Log resources are currently only fully released when the process exits.
This leads to the persistence of the reposense.log.0.lck lock file in
some scenarios.

Let's release the log file resource at the end of RepoSense execution.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor Json comparison methods and resources in systemtest (#1745)
commitResults.messageBody:
The current structure of the system tests is such that it is meant to
only support the ConfigSystemTest. As such, the Json comparison methods
in ConfigSystemTest are not reusable. The resources used are also not
properly grouped.

This change aims to refactor some of the more useful Json comparison
methods so that they can be reused for future system tests.
Additionally, the resources are now grouped by the class file that is 
using them. 

Let's refactor the methods and resources in systemTest to make it easier
to implement new system test cases.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor GitClone::clone method to increase flexibility in usage (#1749)
commitResults.messageBody:
There are various methods in GitClone that are used only in testing.
However, they are still part of the main code and frequently updated.

This change would refactor the clone to cloneAndBranch, and move these
methods to a testing utility class to reduce the maintenance burden. A
more generic GitClone::clone method is also added in its place for
flexible usage during testing.

Let's move the GitClone::clone and cloneBare method to a testing class
to improve the ease of maintenance and implement a more generic clone
method for more flexible usage.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1637] Add system test cases for local repositories (#1746)
commitResults.messageBody:
This will add new system test cases for testing two core issues
previously pertaining to 1. relative pathing and 2. two local
repositories sharing the same final directory.

This also serves as a template for possible future system tests.

Let's add some system test cases for local repositories.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1621] Docs: case 3 report and settings links do not match (#1623)
commitResults.messageBody:
Some of the links in showcase.md do not match the links given in the
address bar. In some cases, the links do not match the respective
descriptions or repository. 

In addition, some reports were generated using an older version of
RepoSense, which results in different URL parameters.

Let's change these links and use newer reports for consistency in the
URL style.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add wildcard type parameter to TestUtil.java (#1642)
commitResults.messageBody:
IntelliJ throws a warning that loadResource parameter classForLoading
uses raw type for Class. This warning is similar to
javac -Xlint:rawtypes.

Let's add a wildcard type parameter to Class to remove that warning.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1539] Fix console error when doing individual merge group (#1618)
commitResults.messageBody:
Passing slice.repoId to getBaseLink() after merging groups causes the
console error to happen. This is due to
window.REPOS[slice.repoId].location being undefined.

Let's put repoId in the commit itself and rename the "slice" argument
to "commit". This should give a valid commit.repoId since getLink()
for v-ramp takes in a commit. This would also allow the usage of
commit.repoId for separate users instead of user.repoId.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1601] Convert datetime functionalities to java.time package (#1625)
commitResults.messageBody:
SimpleDateFormat, Date and Calendar are not thread-safe, resulting in
tests occasionally failing when multi-threading functionality is used.

Let's use DateTimeFormatter and the java.time package APIs since they
are thread-safe.

commitResults.messageTitle: Docs: fix table format in configFiles.md (#1666)
commitResults.messageBody:
IntelliJ shows a compatibility warning for tables in configFiles.md
saying that all rows should have pipe borders at the start and end.

Let's add the borders to resolve this.

commitResults.messageTitle: Docs: update ternary operator in the style guide (#1688)
commitResults.messageBody:
The ternary style guide in the documentation refers to the Date class,
which has been replaced with LocalDateTime in the code.

Let's update the style guide example accordingly.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1711] Upgrade to Cypress 9.5.1
commitResults.messageBody:
Cypress 9.5.1 is now available but we are still on 7.0.1.

Let's upgrade Cypress to use the latest version.

commitResults.messageTitle: Upgrade Gradle to 6.9.2 (#1664)
commitResults.messageBody:
Gradle has been stuck at 5.2.1 for quite some time. This version is not
compatible with a future migration to Java 17. However, upgrading to
Gradle 7.4 cannot be done yet due to a need to resolve errors from
third-party plugins.

Let's upgrade Gradle to 6.9.2 in the meantime to close the gap between
the version we are using and the latest available version.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1651] Enhance Checkstyle (#1652)
commitResults.messageBody:
Checkstyle 8.1 does not have checks for certain Javadoc standards like
whitespace after asterisks and an empty line between description and
block tag group. At the same time, it is tedious to type out all 3
checkstyle tasks for gradlew.

Let's migrate to Checkstyle 9.3 to add the missing checks and create a
consolidated checkstyleAll task to manage all 3 checkstyle tasks.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1202] Missing javadoc for functions (#1650)
commitResults.messageBody:
Some non-trivial private methods have no Javadoc. At the same time, 
Javadoc styles vary across the files. This is also due to some Javadoc
checks not being used in Checkstyle.

Let's add the missing Javadoc, standardize the style and implement
additional checks in Checkstyle.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1703] Upgrade Node.js to 14 (#1714)
commitResults.messageBody:
The node versions used in GitHub Actions and build.gradle do not match.
At the same time, Node.js 10 has reached end of life, while Node.js 12
will reach end of life on 30 April 2022.

Let's update Node.js to use Node 14.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1704] Upgrade to JUnit 5 (#1705)
commitResults.messageBody:
JUnit 5 has new features which may be worth using in the future.

Let's upgrade our tests to use it.

commitResults.messageTitle: Gradle: update node and execfork plugins to newer versions (#1744)
commitResults.messageBody:
The com.github.psxpaul.execfork and com.liferay.node have newer versions
available (0.2.0 and 7.2.16 respectively), and they are compatible with
Java 8 and Gradle 6.9.2 that we are currently using.

Let's upgrade them to move closer towards Gradle 7.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1630] Rearrange Gradle tasks and their dependencies (#1631)
commitResults.messageBody:
When running pure backend tests alone using gradlew test systemtest, the
frontend is built before these tests. This is due to zipReport task
being needed for compileJava. zipReport in turn relies on buildFrontend.

The frontend is not used for these tests. It is wasteful to run 
buildFrontend when only the backend tests are being run.

In addition, some other tasks and properties are scattered throughout
the build.gradle file or have dependencies that could be pushed forward.
This complicates maintenance.

Let's remove the `test` and `systemtest` dependency on the frontend as
well as re-order and consolidate some task properties and dependencies.
This should make running either of them faster.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1734] DevOps: update uploading of coverage reports to Codecov (#1735)
commitResults.messageBody:
The Codecov bash uploader has been deprecated since February 2022 and
may stop working at any time, causing the coverage reports used for pull
requests to not be generated once that happens.

In addition, the code coverage has always been specific to the Ubuntu
environment, and Codecov often incorrectly report missing coverage for
Windows-specific code.

Let's switch to the new uploader using the codecov/codecov-action GitHub
Action, and expand the coverage testing to include Mac and Windows.

commitResults.messageTitle: GitHub Actions: Change node version semantic for Cypress (#1755)
commitResults.messageBody:
The node-version semantic used for cypress does not match those in other
jobs.

Let's change the node-version semantic for cypress.

commitResults.messageTitle: Docs: update, fix typos and improve docs for flag conflicts (#1724)
commitResults.messageBody:
Some parts of the docs are out-of-date or have typos. At the same time,
there is no mention of what happens when conflicting flags are used
together.

Let's update the docs and describe what happens for each flag conflict.

commitResults.messageTitle: Checkstyle: implement new checks and update throwsIndent value (#1757)
commitResults.messageBody:
There are unimplemented checks which can help enforce our coding
standards. In particular, the SingleSpaceSeparator check can detect the
additional whitespaces in RepoConfigParserTest.

The default value for throwsIndent in the Indentation check is 4
whitespaces even though we normally use 8 whitespaces.

Let's implement these new checks and update the throwsIndent value.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1774] Fix unintended behavior related to --since d1 (#1776)
commitResults.messageBody:
The use of Instant.ofEpochMilli(Long.MIN_VALUE) as the arbitrary first
commit date now fails shallow cloning for
testSinceBeginningDateRangeWithShallowCloning system test.

In addition, using this arbitrary date in convertToGitDateRangeArgs
when converting timezone results in an overflow causing sinceDate to
be greater than untilDate. Thus, no commit results are retrieved,
leading to failing system tests.

Also, the arbitrary first commit date is in UTC. However, in the
convertToGitDateRangeArgs method, the zoneId used for the conversion
is from the config, which may be different. This leads to an erroneous
timezone conversion.

Finally, using --since d1 with --period results in an unintended date
range because the --period and the arbitrary commit date from 
--since d1 are used to calculate the until date as the actual 
earliest commit date is not immediately available.

Let's change Instant.ofEpochMilli() to use 0 so that the arbitrary date
is 1970-01-01 and the overflow of the sinceDate can be avoided.

At the same time, let's convert the arbitrary date to the correct
timezone within the ArgsParser class and add a component test for
parsing --since d1 to check that the correct timezone is used for each
RepoConfiguration before cloning any repos.

Finally, let's raise a warning when --since d1 is being used with 
--period.

commitResults.messageTitle: GitHub Actions: update deps to latest versions (#1763)
commitResults.messageBody:
Many actions that we use have been updated. Most of the updates are
related to the underlying actions upgrading from Node 12 to 16.

Let's use the updated versions in our workflows.

commitResults.messageTitle: Docs: fix broken links in about.md (#1777)
commitResults.messageBody:
The CDTL link in about.md is different from the actual one in use. In
addition, the GitHub link for one contributor appears to have changed.
The link with the original name no longer works.

Let's update the links.

commitResults.messageTitle: Frontend: change JavaScript line length limit for ESLint (#1766)
commitResults.messageBody:
There is a mismatch between the JavaScript line length limit allowed
in .eslintrc.json and the hard limit in the coding standard.

Let's change the allowed limit in .eslintrc.json and update the files
that fail the check upon this change.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1764] Actions: refactor Cypress CI build step (#1767)
commitResults.messageBody:
The Install packages step looks for a non-existent package.json file.
The Set up Cypress step is basically a repeat of installCypress within
build.gradle, which runs before frontendTest task.

Let's remove both steps from Cypress CI.

commitResults.messageTitle: Frontend Lint: add ts file extension to eslint (#1761)
commitResults.messageBody:
The eslint file types do not include ts. This means that lint errors in
ts files such as main.ts will go undetected.

Let's update the lint and lintfix scripts to include the ts file type
for eslint.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1661] Upgrade to Gradle 7 (#1780)
commitResults.messageBody:
The Liferay plugin has recently been updated with annotations for
Gradle 7. As Gradle 7 is now available for use, this also means that the
Shadow plugin can be updated to the latest version.

There are some deprecated features that will be removed in a future
Gradle 8 release. These include an implicit dependency between
processResources and zipReport and the change from Report.enabled to
Report.required.

The processSystemtestResources task fails because Gradle 7 requires a
duplicatesStrategy to be defined for the task, which is of the Copy
type.

Let's upgrade to Gradle 7, update the relevant plugins and fix the
duplicatesStrategy error as well as deprecations related to Gradle 8.

commitResults.messageTitle: Frontend: update Node packages and fix code for checks (#1762)
commitResults.messageBody:
Many dependencies are not up to date with the latest versions. This
gives rise to vulnerabilities as well as dependency conflicts when
attempting to run npm update.

In addition, there are ESLint checks for Airbnb JS standards which fail
upon updating these dependencies.

Let's update the dependencies and refactor the Javascript code
accordingly.

commitResults.messageTitle: Hotfix: revert highlight.js from version 11 to 10 (#1819)
commitResults.messageBody:
After upgrading highlight.js to version 11, the formatting of code in
the code panel breaks.

Let's revert highlight.js back to version 10.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1765] Change npm version requirement to Node.js (#1786)
commitResults.messageBody:
Node.js is often installed together with npm. With regards to tracking
version LTS and EOL, Node.js is often used instead of npm. Thus, it is
easier to update the Node.js version in the DG whenever the existing
version goes EOL and we upgrade to a newer version.

On the other hand, when updating the corresponding npm version, there
is a need to look for the Node.js version and then find the
corresponding npm version.

Let's change the DG pre-requisites to reference the Node.js version and
specify that it is for npm. This improves maintainability of the DG.

commitResults.messageTitle: Gradle: update Node 14 minor release version  (#1824)
commitResults.messageBody:
The current Node version for Gradle is 14.19.0. However, the latest
available version of Node 14 is 14.20.0.

Let's upgrade the Node 14 minor release version in build.gradle.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1591] Omit percentile if the list is sorted alphabetically (#1610)
commitResults.messageBody:
Omit percentile if the list is not sorted by contribution

The percentage is only useful when the list is sorted by contribution.
It can be confusing in other cases.

Let's change it such that the percentage is only displayed when the
list is sorted by contribution.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1597] Remove duplicate error messages in error summary (#1605)
commitResults.messageBody:
Duplicate error messages appear in the error summary shown in the
final report when the same repository has errors in multiple
configuration files.

Let's change the error summary data structure from List to Set to
remove duplicate error messages without affecting performance. The
order of error messages may change, but should not be a problem.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1540] Remove Cypress.wait() at the start of cypress tests (#1643)
commitResults.messageBody:
Cypress.wait() is placed at the start of every cypress test. However,
they do not serve any purpose other than to slow down the tests.

Let's remove them to speed up frontend testing.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1603] Terminate if a CSV config file has an unknown column (#1609)
commitResults.messageBody:
RepoSense does not show any error if a config file has an unknown
column as it is likely to be a user mistake that could affect the
output.

Let's add a new exception (InvalidHeaderException) to handle this, as
using InvalidCsvException will not terminate the program. The check is
done within CsvParser::validateHeader.

The original code already handles case insensitive matching of column
names.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1627, #1633] Upgrade frontend to Vue3 (#1646)
commitResults.messageBody:
Vue 3 offers performance gain and better Typescript support.

Let's upgrade to the latest version of Vue.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1634] Replace cdn links to import from node_modules instead (#1710)
commitResults.messageBody:
Some css files are currently imported directly in the code, making it
difficult to manage.

Let us import from node_module for easy management.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1632] Frontend: Add TypeScript (#1721)
commitResults.messageBody:
TypeScript offers precise definition through typing, which makes code
management easier.

Let's start transitioning our frontend code to use TypeScript.

commitResults.messageTitle: Support frontend hot reload on Linux (#1620)
commitResults.messageBody:
The hotReloadFrontend gradle task does not support Linux. Apache
ant's `Os` class does not have an OS family specifically for Linux.
The Mac hot reload feature also does not appear to work.

Let's:
- add hot reload for Linux using gradle's OperatingSystem::isLinux
- use `npm run serveOpen` command for both Mac and Linux

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1615] Clear deployments for closed pull requests (#1654)
commitResults.messageBody:
Deployment previews generated for open PRs are not cleared
automatically when a PR is closed or merged. As a result, environments
need to be cleared manually periodically, which is less than ideal.

Let's add a GitHub workflow for closed (which includes merged) PRs
that deletes generated preview environments automatically, and posts 
a comment on the PR with the preview links for later reference.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1648] Frontend: display reportTitle as browser tab title (#1656)
commitResults.messageBody:
The title of the browser window displays 'reposense' instead of the 
`reportTitle` as specified in report-config.json. This is becuase the 
default index page title in the backend is wrongly specified. 

Let's correctly specify the default index page title, so that it gets 
correctly replaced by the specified reportTitle and shown in the browser
tab.

commitResults.messageTitle: Actions: use pull_request_target for delete deploy workflow (#1675)
commitResults.messageBody:
The delete deployments workflow merged in #1654 doesn't work for PRs 
from forked repos due to insufficient GitHub token permissions.

Additionally, the pending and surge workflows use fetch-depth: 0 when
checking out the repository, which unnecessarily fetches the full
history of the repository and cause the workflow to be slightly slower.

Let's use the pull_request_target workflow (instead of pull_request) 
which provides necessary permissions for the delete task, and give the
task a name. Let's also remove the unnecessary fetch-depth: 0 from the
pending and surge workflows.

commitResults.messageTitle: Actions: pull deployment info specific to the PR for deletion (#1677)
commitResults.messageBody:
For the delete deployment workflow, we are pulling all deployments in
the repo and filtering by PR ID. Hence, it is likely that older 
deployments will not be included in the 30 that is returned by the
GitHub API by default.

Let's fix this by pulling only deployments specific to the environments
to be deleted, and increasing the limit from 30 to 100 (which is the
maximum), to ensure that all deployment IDs for a PR are correctly
pulled and deleted.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1655] Remove duplicated method in GitRevList (#1690)
commitResults.messageBody:
The methods `getCommitHashBeforeDate` and `getCommitHashUntilDate` in
GitRevList.java have identical logic.

Let's remove `getCommitHashBeforeDate` and replace the `--before` flag 
in `getCommitHashUntilDate` with `--until` to match with the method 
name.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1659] Separate backend and frontend responsibilites (#1691)
commitResults.messageBody:
The backend modifies files generated by the frontend. This breaks the
separation of responsibilities for generated report files, which makes 
testing more challenging.

Let's stop the backend manually modifying report titles in frontend
generated files, and have the frontend update the report title itself. 
The default report title generated by the frontend is now also 
'RepoSense Report' instead of 'reposense' so that there is no delay in
updating the report title in the default case. The backend will proceed
to generate report files in the absence of `templateZip.zip`. Let's
also add a test to check that report titles are correctly updated.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1723] Run Windows CI on GitHub Actions instead of AppVeyor (#1731)
commitResults.messageBody:
Due to historical reasons, Linux and Mac CI are run on GitHub Actions
while Windows CI is run on AppVeyor. This makes Windows CI hard to
monitor and maintain.

Let's run CI on Windows (windows-2022, windows-2019) on GitHub Actions
as well. Let's also stop using AppVeyor and remove AppVeyor CI scripts.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1738] Remove dependence of Cypress tests on RepoSense master (#1741)
commitResults.messageBody:
Cypress tests depend on RepoSense master which is constantly changing.
This can break tests as it did when #1731 was merged.

Let's use a separate branch 'cypress' in the RepoSense repository to
generate fixed reports for frontend tests that are not affected by
merges to master. Changes required for testing new frontend features
can be made to the cypress branch which will be independent of master.
Let's also remove the AppVeyor CI badge since we no longer use it as
of PR #1731.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#231] Modify local repository URL to the correct remote repository (#1679)
commitResults.messageBody:
Local repositories cloned from a remote or with remotes added manually
do not have working links to a remote repository, even though remote
repository information can be obtained with `git remote -v`.

Let's create a GitRemote class to obtain available remote repository 
information for local repositories, and use it for generating valid
links in a report.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1504] Add file size limit to prevent large reports crashing (#1647)
commitResults.messageBody:
Reports with files that are large tend to crash the report when rendered
in the authorship view. Furthermore, large files that users may have 
intended to ignore are analyzed and included in the report, causing
bloated reports and slow report generation.

Let's address these by:
- Adding a frontend overall character limit to render only files that in
total are under the character limit.
- Implement an override-able and ignore-able file size limit that can 
be used either to skip analysis entirely or to analyze but not include 
line diffs in the final report

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1680] Delete PR deployments with >100 deployments (#1732)
commitResults.messageBody:
Since the GitHub API only allows 100 deployment IDs to be obtained at a
time, only the 100 most recent PR deployments are deleted, which may be
exceeded in long-running PRs.

Let's delete all PR deployments by fetching all available pages of
deployments.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1748] Lazy loading for code segments in authorship view (#1750)
commitResults.messageBody:
Code segments are loaded all at once in the authorship view which could
take a long time or possibly break the report for especially large
diffs.

Let's implement lazy loading by only rendering code segments that are
visible to the user, to speed up report loading. Let's also replace the
overall character limit with a single file character limit, since a
large number of small code segments slowing down report loading is no
longer a concern.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1825] Give more info on the File Size Limit in UG (#1829)
commitResults.messageBody:
The documentation on File Size Limit lacks examples and information on
behavior and usage.

Let's improve the documentation by providing more details about the
feature functionality.
